Package mystars.entities

Class Student

  • java.lang.Object
    • mystars.entities.Entity
      • mystars.entities.User
        • mystars.entities.Student
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Student
extends User
    This student class inherits from the user class, and is responsible for the creation of a new student object.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Student

        public Student​(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String email,
               java.lang.String matricNo,
               java.lang.String username,
               java.lang.String password,
               Gender gender,
               Nationality nationality)
        throws AppException
        This class is responsible for the creation of a student object.
        Parameters:
        name - The student's name.
        email - The student's email.
        matricNo - The student's matriculation number.
        username - The student's username.
        password - The student's password.
        gender - The student's gender.
        nationality - The student's nationality.
        Throws:
        AppException - If there already exists a user with the same username.

      • login

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String password)
              throws AppException
        Override the base login to only allow the student to login if the current time is within the configured access period
        Overrides:
        login in class User
        Parameters:
        password - The user's password.
        Returns:
        true if the student has logged in successfully, or false otherwise
        Throws:
        AppException - if the student is not allowed to login right now

      • assertCanLogin

        private void assertCanLogin()
                     throws AppException
        Determine whether a student is allowed to login based on the current time and access period configured. If the access period is not configured, this function always returns false.
        Throws:
        AppException - if the student is not allowed to login right now

      • setAccessPeriod

        public static void setAccessPeriod​(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime end)
        Set the access period start and end date and times for the student object.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting date and time of MySTARS access period.
        end - The ending date and time of MySTARS access period.

      • getAccessPeriod

        public static java.lang.String getAccessPeriod()
        Retrieve the period in which students are allowed to login as a string.
        Returns:
        "yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss" if a access period is set, or null otherwise.
